content.prompt:
Photograph © The Cleveland Museum of Art

The material and shape of object shown from Chavín de Huántar indicates its likely function as a

choices.label: trade object used as a type of ancient currency
diadem used to adorn a statue of a god in a private shrine
nose ornament belonging to a high-ranking individual
votive object given to a deity for the fulfillment of a wish

topic.text: 5.3: Purpose and Audience in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Explain how the possible intent, purpose, and/or function shape the creation or meaning of a work of art (or group of related works of art).
